dialogues.text: Just wrap your thong around the branch and slide down. (then, to Max and Fabrizio) You hear what I said to him? X-Ray throws his bag to the ground and grabs the branch. starts to lower, but then it STOPS, leaving him DANGLING feet above the ground. X-Ray’s weight is not enough to br the branch all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Help! Help!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: You should’ve kept your backpack on, so you'd be heavier!

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: I took it off to be more nimble. X-Ray shakes, but the branch doesn’t move. A BEE buzzes b Ray’s face.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bee! I’m allergic! He frantically tries blowing it away. The bee STINGS him.  21.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Owww!! It stung me! Get my epi-pen! My throat’s gonna close! Fabrizio springs to action and grabs X-Ray’s bag, searchi for the epi-pen.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m gonna drop. Catch me! Max and Quentin gather underneath X-Ray, arms outstretche He DROPS and lands between them with a THUD.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Owww! Fabrizio pulls the pen out of X-Ray’s bag and JABS it int Ray’s thigh.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Owww! CLOSE ON a UNI-BALL PEN sticking out of his leg.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?!

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: You say a’pen! A’pen!

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Epi-pen! Epi-pen! Fucking idiot! Max pulls the real EPIPEN out of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Found it! Max jabs it into X-Ray’s other leg.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (weakly) Thank you. (then, to Fabrizio) Sorry I called you an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Is okay.
The school recedes in the background. X-Ray LIMPS behind others. His pants have puncture wounds and his cheek is hugely swollen from the sting.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: «+. My sister said girls hate the word, “moist.”

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Why? Quentin shrugs. Max smells his armpit.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m moist right now. Quentin turns back and takes a photo of X-Ray’s face.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Taking a snap of that baby dick on your cheek. Max smacks Quentin’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No snaps, no stories. Nothing. We can’t be tracked. We have to stay off the grid. Max's phone buzzes. He checks it. Quentin smacks Max's

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What about staying off the grid?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We got a buyer! The guys CHEER. They step out of the woods and onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hand. Their celebration is short-lived as a POLICE CRUISER, lig flashing, pulls up alongside them.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Lemme do the talking. The OFFICER sticks his head out.  23.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello, Officer. Just want to say “All Lives Matter.”

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you boys be in school? A moment of panic as the guys all intuitively turn to Max thinks quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It’s a Jewish holiday. We're going to temple.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Oh, you're Jews? (then, gives them once- over) Stay on the sidewalks. The Officer drives off.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: That was genius!

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: I liked it! Quentin’s annoyed that someone else is receiving adulatio

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s “genius” to lie about religion. With what’s happening in the world today. This seems like a deep observation. They contemplate it. INT. FABRIZIO’S HOUSE - LATER Quentin and Max play Grand Theft Auto while Fabrizio watc with interest. X-Ray peers out the window, impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Where the hell is this guy? He was supposed to be here already.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: He’s coming. Relax. Max's Avatar lies prone on a rooftop, taking aim at a FEM COP, who stands beside a trash can fire. He shoots and misses.  24.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you shooting that cop? You're wasting bullets.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That’s St. Cloud. She’s not even a cop. She’s bad. She just dresses like one to rob drug dealers.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: My dads say that these types of games make you numb to violence. St. Cloud comes at the Avatar and Max shoots her POINT-BL in the face, causing her head to EXPLODE. None of them re

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wish you could see more brains in her hair.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: If you run her over, she'll shit herself. The doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Finally. He’s about to open the door when --

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (whispers) Wait! What if he’s a pedophile?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (considers) He can’t molest all of us.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: He could if he drugs us.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: If he offers you anything to drink, do not take it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Maybe we should get some weapons, just to be safe.  25.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (through the door) One minute please! Just need to put something on! INT. FABRIZIO’S FRONT HALL - MOMENTS LATER The boys are weaponed up: Max holds a broomstick. Quentin a tennis racket. X-Ray enters with a PAINTBALL GUN.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Switch. Quentin snatches the paintball gun and hands X-Ray the te racket.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: What the hell, Quentin? That was mine.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: It’s not a toy, okay? Better that I hold it. Quentin tucks it in his elastic waistband. Fabrizio races down the steps. He’s wearing an S&M MASK a holding a set of ANAL BEADS.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Ugh, gross. Those smell like shit! They all take a strong whiff.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What are those?

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: I dunno. I find in Bill and Nancy’s bedroom. I use to hit. Fabrizio whips the anal beads over his shoulder like nunchucks and smacks X-Ray in the face.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Stop! X-Ray opens the door to REVEAL -- a balding MAN wearing a Vassar College t-shirt.  26. He is surprised to be facing four twelve year old boys, o wearing a leather S&M mask.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Hello... I’m looking for Max?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m Max. Max politely extends his hand. Claude shakes it uncertain

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Are you a pedophile?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (to Quentin) If you were a pedophile, would you admit it?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then why would he?

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I’m not a pedophile.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: See? We don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: I’m not!

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Do you have the money, Claude?

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Okay, yes you come now to basement but no shoes. INT. FABRIZIO’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - DAY CLOSE UP: A SEX DOLL’S lifeless eyes and open mouth. Clau inspects the doll carefully, gently opens her mouth.  27.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: And is this her original mouth and tongue?

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Claude notices the kids looking at him strangely.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: (covering) Oh, oh. You think? No, no! I want Peaches for the carpool lane... so I can get home to my family faster.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS
dialogues.text: Ohhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: We thought you wanted to fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Ha ha terrific! I think you mean, “Fuck her.” Claude hands Fabrizio a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you go. Four hundred.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No, it’s five-fifty. That’s what we said in the ad.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but now that I’m here and looking at it and it’s out of the box -- I feel like it’s only worth four. Quentin holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Claude, you have to see it from our side: we're running a business here. If you don’t like the price, no hard feelings. Have a great day. The boys look at Quentin like he’s crazy. Quentin turns t Max.  28.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Max, give that married couple a call and tell them they can pick up the doll. Claude considers this.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t want to lose her. He pulls out some more bills, hands Fabrizio all the cash pulls out a sundress from his satchel.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you help me dress her?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Of course, Claude. The Boys dutifully lift up the doll’s arms as Claude pull sundress from his bag and slides it over her arms. EXT. FABRIZIO’S HOUSE - DAY The Boys struggle to carry Peaches to Claude’s Maxima.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: You can just toss her in the trunk. He opens the trunk and motions for them to place her insi

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Didn't you need her up front for the carpool lane?

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: «+. Right. He opens the passenger door and the guys put her in. Quen extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Best of luck with everything.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: ... Thank you. Claude gets in the car and drives off. They wave goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I liked Claude. He was relatable.  29.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (realizing) Dammit! We should’ve asked him for a ride to the mall. OVER DEMI LOVATO’S “CONFIDENT”: EXT. FABRIZIO’S HOUSE - LATER The garage OPENS and the boys step out, rolling out a wom bike and a seven year old girl’s bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The boys apply liberal amounts of sunblock to any expo skin. They help each other apply lotion to their necks. -- Velcro straps are fastened around ELBOW PADS. -- HELMET straps are tightened. -- Water bottles are inserted into water bottle slots ina backpack. -- X-Ray clips on a REFLECTOR VEST.

dialogues.speaker: CHYRON
dialogues.text: They’re about to set off.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (checks watch) Come on, come on! We’re behind schedule. Max runs back into the garage and comes out with the PAINTBALL GUN.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Why are you bringing that?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You never know... if the girls come at us... (holds up gun) We can bribe them with this to let us go. Everyone loves paintball guns. Quentin holds the little pink bike.  30.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’m not riding this. It can’t fit my balls. (then, to X-Ray) Switch. Quentin takes X-Ray’s bike. Max leans over to X-Ray.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You gotta stand up for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: It’s fine...

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let's a’go! They look over to see Fabrizio. He’s riding a road bike w clip-ons. They pull out onto the street. Max sees Quentin isn’t wea his helmet.

dialogues.text: Quentin, put on your helmet! We’re going on a main street!

dialogues.text: Hannah sits in math class, bored. A MATH TEACHER motions right triangle on the board.

dialogues.speaker: MATH TEACHER
dialogues.text: So if side “A” is 4, and side “B” is 9, what is the length of the hypotenuse? Everyone is silent. Hannah looks up, notices Lily in the little window in the classroom door. Hannah raises her ha

dialogues.text: May I go to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: MATH TEACHER
dialogues.text: ("why do I bother?”) Take a pass.  31.

dialogues.text: Lily holds out her phone to Hannah and Jaslyn, who’s also joined. A map with a blinking, moving cursor is on the sc

dialogues.text: I put on “Find Your iPhone.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A map with a blinking, moving cursor on the screen.

dialogues.text: That little shit left school. Where is he going in the middle of a school day?

dialogues.text: Maybe they’re going to the cops.

dialogues.text: Now I think we need to call Jordy.

dialogues.text: The boys bike down an empty street, laughing and smiling. They try to bike with no hands. This is freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They unsuccessfully try to pull wheelies, jump curbs, bunny-hop, etc. -- The boys bike through a SPRINKLER, legs outstretched. -- A dog runs up to the edge of a fence and BARKS at them The boys, startled, speed off, laughing. Pure joy.

dialogues.text: The boys walk their bikes through a cross-walk.  32.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: «+. Did you know a blow job and oral sex are the same thing?

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: «+. Jeremy Renner is the best Jason Bourne. He’s Hawkeye. Matt Damon was only good in “We Bought a Zoo.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: ... You know who’s gotten really good at comebacks? Atticus L.

dialogues.text: The boys have stopped to rest. Max drinks from a water bottle, passes it to the others. A PICKUP TRUCK pulling a COVERED TRAILER slows to a stop. Emblazoned on the side is “MONSTER ENERGY DRINK: UNLEASH BEAST.” Through a fenced-in window on the side of the trailer, TW YELLOW EYES appear.

dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.text: What is it? (calling to Driver) What do you have back there? The Pick-Up Driver ignores the boys as he turns onto the congested 101 on-ramp.

dialogues.text: Hey, doesn’t it feel like we’ve been biking forever? How much longer? X-Ray checks his Apple Watch.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO

dialogues.text: No, in steps!

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (pushes a button) 3144.

dialogues.text: Let me see your watch. Max looks at X-Ray’s GPS app.

dialogues.text: You put it in for car, not for a bike! He types.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s no way we’re gonna be back by the end of lunch. They’re gonna know we‘re gone.

dialogues.text: If we get caught, they won’t let us sing in the recital.

dialogues.text: Quentin, you have Uber.  34.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: No way! It goes straight to my dad’s phone. He’1l know.

dialogues.text: We're a’fucked.

dialogues.text: Forget the recital --

dialogues.text: I didn’t mean, like, “forget about the recital.” I mean, if we don’t get that drone back, the next time we see X-Ray, his face will be covered in jizz.

dialogues.text: Matt Chestnut told Aiden Price that at Camden Academy, the eighth graders jerk off on the seventh graders’ faces. And if you don’t say “Thank you,” they punch you in the nuts. X-Ray puts his head in his hands. Max puts his arm around him.

dialogues.text: Don’t worry, it’s probably just a stupid rumor. Quentin shakes his head at Max and Fabrizio like, “No, th real.”

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Also, I heard they make everyone shower after gym and the older kids will punch you in the nuts if you don’t have pubes.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Quentin!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Well, hopefully, it won’t get to that.  35.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: How do we even make up time? I’m pedaling as fast as I can.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (looking at phone) I find shortcut. I/E. LILY’S MINI COOPER - DAY Top down. The radio plays. Jaslyn checks the “Find Your iPhone” app.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: He should be pretty close. (then) Turn right here. She points to the 101 freeway on-ramp.

dialogues.text: I haven't driven on the freeway without my dad. Hannah rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t roll your eyes at me!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I wasn’t. I was rolling my eyes at the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumper to bumper traffic. Cars honk. On the edge of the southbound side -- MAX, QUENTIN, X-RAY, and FABRIZIO.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: This is genius.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Grazie. The boys step onto the FREEWAY and weave their way throug the gridlock. DRIVERS poke their heads out of the car, shocked to see twelve year olds on bikes crossing a major freeway.  36.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Guys, get back to the side!

dialogues.speaker: OLDER DRIVER
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Eat my balls! The Older Driver shakes his head as the boys reach the MEDIAN. ON LILY’S MINI COOPER stuck in traffic.

dialogues.text: I don’t get it. It says we're, like, on top of him.

dialogues.text: (pointing) There! She points to the boys CROSSING the freeway.

dialogues.text: The boys make their way to the MEDIAN. The northbound tra is still crawling along. The guys celebrate.

dialogues.text: (pointing) Guys! Check it out! Celebrity sighting! They all look in the direction they just came from.

dialogues.text: Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: TURN TO REVEAL

dialogues.text: I guarantee that’s the real one.  37.

dialogues.text: Why would Optimus Prime have a human driver? That makes no sense.

dialogues.speaker: MAX

dialogues.text: They just want to get home. They all motion for the driver to honk his air horn, rais and lowering their arms feverishly. The DRIVER notices them, rolls down his window.

dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing? Get off the freeway!

dialogues.text: Blow your horn! Blow your horn! The Driver shakes his head, then pulls on his air horn. T boys explode in CHEERS and HIGH-FIVES.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Alright, we should keep going. They turn around. The traffic has picked up. Cars now whi at 70 MPH. The boys are startled by the sound of the zoom cars.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck. What do we do?

dialogues.text: We should go back. They turn back to see that the southbound traffic has beg moving as well.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're trapped! Cars speed past them on both sides. Drivers honk and poin

dialogues.text: (nervous ) We're not trapped. We just need to time it.  38.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Is like video game. They nod. They stare at the traffic, trying to time it, t

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Now! Max, Quentin and Fabrizio pedal furiously across the free amid the sounds of long honks and screeching brakes. They make it across, followed closely by X-Ray, who RUNS HIS BIKE BESIDE HIM. As he makes it to the safety of the shoulder, an SUV hits BACK WHEEL of his bike, sending it FLYING into an -- ONCOMING PRIUS. The boys watch in horror as the Prius BRAKES to avoid the FLYING BICYCLE, which causes -- The Monster Energy Drink TRUCK to SWERVE -- FLIPPING the hitched trailer onto its side. Sparks fly as rear-ends the Prius, which pancakes into the SUV. The battered rear door of the trailer hangs from a hinge. Cars behind them slam on the brakes, but it’s too late. E car SMASHES the one in front.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOYS
dialogues.text: Staring, slack-jawed.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We should go. They hastily pull their bikes up the embankment.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FREEWAY
dialogues.text: DRIVERS step out of their cars to survey the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude and Peaches (the sex doll), now in the carpool lan Claude sighs, stares out the windshield at the gridlock.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Come on!! ON LILY’S MINI  39. Now stopped in the gridlock. Hannah stands on her seat to a better view.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: There's a trailer flipped on its side. We’re gonna be here forever.
