dialogues.text: The crumpled rear door swings OPEN -- And the two yellow eyes EMERGE from the darkness. They belong to a LION who surveys the unfamiliar surround and lets out a mighty ROAR. The Pick-Up Driver hops out of the cab, sees the lion, an immediately hops back in and locks his door.

dialogues.speaker: THE LION
dialogues.text: In predator mode, the beast stalks its way through the gridlock. CLICK CLICK CLICK. In rapid succession, automatic locks s closed. ON LILY’S MINI Not moving. Jaslyn stands up on her seat to get a better look. She immediately drops back down.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Close the top. Now. Right now! The Lion emerges from between two cars and stops, studyin Lily’s convertible. It ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Abhh!!! Lily slams the button to close the roof.

dialogues.speaker: VRRRRRRR..-
dialogues.text: The convertible roof motor slowly whirs to life. It feels like an eternity. People watch from the safety o their own cars.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Come on!  40.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Push harder!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: This is as fast as it fucking goes, Jaslyn!! The Lion jumps onto the hood and lets out a ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHH
dialogues.text: The Girls scream in terror, but that doesn’t stop Jaslyn pulling out her phone to record. She turns the phone on herself and immediately makes a po face as she continues to scream. The Lion makes its way up the hood, putting its enormous on the windshield. A single sheet of glass now separates them. It takes another step, just as the ROOF LOCKS INTO PLACE. It crawls onto the roof, which begins to BUCKLE and jumps off, disappearing between the stopped cars.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: (into camera phone) I am in shock. I almost just -- She lowers the phone, fixes her hair, and starts over.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am in shock. I almost just died. Suddenly, they HEAR an earth-shattering SCREAM. The whip around to see -- THE LION VIOLENTLY PULLING a WOMAN THROUGH THE OPEN WINDO A PASSENGER SEAT. It’s horrific. Fortunately, it’s not a woman. It’s Peaches (the sex doll Claude desperately holds onto her by her legs.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: (to Lion) No! Stop it! Bad! The Lion tears Peaches’ head off and stalks away. It pass Hannah's car with the head in his mouth. The girls let ou blood-curdling scream.  41.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON CLAUDE
dialogues.text: Staring at the headless doll. He opens the front of her dress, making sure everything is intact. Breathes a sigh relief.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That could’ve been bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small shops and restaurants. The boys pedal furiously, weaving in and out of pedestrian traffic. X-Ray checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: We’re almost there -- (then) Nope. Still in car mode. Up ahead, a large demonstration blocks their path. PROTES hold signs and chant outside of a PLANNED PARENTHOOD. As boys get nearer, they make out the signs -- “I CHOOSE LIF “BABIES MURDERED HERE.”

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: We need to get around this nonsense. A sweet-looking girl, WILLA, and a guy with a wispy goate a faded “Mike Huckabee for President” t-shirt, GIDEON, approach them, holding some pamphlets.

dialogues.speaker: WILLA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can we have a minute of your time?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: «+. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: Do you think that murdering babies is wrong?

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Of course. The murder of anyone is wrong.  42.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: What if I told you doctors were killing babies?

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: (handing a pamphlet) Read the literature. Why do you think we're here?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I thought maybe you were unemployed?

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: I’m a screenwriter.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Nice, where are you repped? My dad’s an agent at Don Buchwald and Associates.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: «+. I’m waiting to hear back on some query letters.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: You know, if you get a manager, they can help you get an agent.

dialogues.speaker: WILLA
dialogues.text: (jumping in) So guys, we’re trying to recruit more cool, young people to our movement. Come protest with us!

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: We can’t. We have to get to the mall.

dialogues.speaker: WILLA
dialogues.text: Come on, guys. You don’t really think the mall is more important than a human life.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Uno minuto, please. The guys huddle up.  43.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to a’help. Doctors are a’killing babies. If a’not us, who? If a’not now, when?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: This is our community we’re talking about. Who are these doctors?! How is this not in the news?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We don’t know if it’s our community or a different community.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Guys, maybe we can get on a mailing list and help, but right now we need to get to the mall!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: X-Ray’s right. Max turns to Willa and Gideon.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys seem like really good people, but we need to be back at school before lunch ends or we’1l get caught for ditching.

dialogues.speaker: WILLA
dialogues.text: Tell you what: let us take a few pictures of you holding up signs for our email blast and we’ll call your school and pretend to be your parents.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: And then we'll drive you to the mall. How’s that sound? The boys light up -- all their problems are solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys watch as Gideon finishes up a phone call. He cup the phone to drown out the noise of the protest.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: (into phone) «+. I will definitely make sure to sign them out with you next time. Okay, you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon hangs up, turns to the guys.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, now you have to hold up your end... The boys enthusiastically raise signs and protest aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front of the protest. Willa speaks through a MEGAPHON

dialogues.speaker: WILLA
dialogues.text: Our movement is growing stronger every day. And we will be here for years to come. How do I know? Because I’ve seen the future. And it’s right here. (then, to boys) Come up here, guys. The Protestors part to make a path. The boys, surprised, uncertainly toward the front as the Protestors applaud th WILLA (CONT’D) These guys get it. (then, to boys) I want you to tell this crowd what you told me. She hands the megaphone to Max, but Quentin snatches it a

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Hello, Los Angeles! The crowd hoots and hollers. Quentin loves the adulation.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you, friends. (then) We were on our way to the Fashion Square mall when we were stopped and told that doctors were killing babies. And that ends now. The crowds ERUPTS. Quentin begins pacing back and forth, really getting into it.  45.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what do we do? Do we need to give these babies guns? The crowd loves this idea. Shouts of “YES!” A DOCTOR hust past the crowd toward the clinic entrance. Max takes the megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (to Doctor) You! A murder! The Doctor enters.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t understand! Why isn’t he in jail? The crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Really, why? I don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: Because we live in a world where the Supreme Court says it’s okay for a woman kill her unborn child! (then, to crowd) End abortion now! Max lowers the megaphone. The boys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: What in the ass?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (confused) Wait, wait, wait. Abortions are for fetuses. You said babies.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, my dads say that fetuses are just cells.

dialogues.speaker: WILLA
dialogues.text: Fetuses are babies!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (realizing) Are you anti-abortion? (then, to the other boys) I think they’re anti-abortion!  46.

dialogues.speaker: WILLA
dialogues.text: We're pro-life! The boys gasp.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: You don’t believe in a woman’s right to choose?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willa and Gideon toss their bikes to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: Good luck not going up in hell!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Good luck getting a response to those query letters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boys struggle up a steep hill except for Quentin, who stands on Max’s pegs. X-Ray rides Quentin’s bike.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’m starving. We should get lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER BEETHOVEN'S “SYMPHONY IN A MAJOR” --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOGURT spout as it fills a cup. And keeps filling and filling. Quentin laughs in delight as the yogurt spills o the side. X-Ray lovingly ladles hot fudge onto his towering mound o yogurt. Max scoops every topping imaginable onto his. He reaches beautiful fruit section. He grimaces -- “gross” -- and wa right past it. Fabrizio puts his head under the spout and lets the yogur spill into his mouth. The middle-aged CASHIER sees him.  47.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey! Stop that!

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: What? What I do?

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A Helicopter POV of the now-shut down 101. Cars are backe for miles. CAPTION: Escaped Lion Decapitates Sex Doll, Shuts Down 10 The boys are now seated and messily eating from their overflowing bowls, completely oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Hey, Quentin, guess what?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What? X-Ray FARTS. The others laugh. A SENIOR CITIZEN COUPLE lo over, disgusted. They get up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tonight is going to be so sweet. Quentin FARTS.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Performing. And then we can have a sleepover.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Sick.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: It’s almost literally a perfect night. Max looks down guiltily. The CASHIER approaches their table.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Guys, you have to stop -- He suddenly recoils from the smell.  48.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ugh. You have to stop farting. People are complaining.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: That wasn’t us.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think it was those old people that just left. The Cashier rolls his eyes and begins to walk away. Fabri releases a long, thin, slide-whistle FART. The Cashier whips around.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s it. You’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys cross the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: He was outlandish!

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: What does that word mean?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I can’t describe it. I can just use it in a sentence.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Okay. Gimme the sentence.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I already said it! “He was outlandish!” I can’t be any clearer. They reach the bike rack. Lily’s Mini is waiting for them

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Hey, cuties. Miss us?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Just give me back my bag. I need my phone and all my shit.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Not until you give us the code to your phone so we can delete the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: No! I have private texts and pictures of family members!

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Just give us the fucking bag.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: No!! Hannah starts to open her door.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (panicked) If you get out of the car, I’1l scream. The Girls roll their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If you don’t give us the bag, we'll tell everyone at your school that you’re homophobes.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (re Quentin) His dads are gay!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: So lick my balls.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Fine, we'll say you’re racist.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I‘1l sue you for libel and take your parent’s house, darling!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Okay, fuck this. Hannah throws opens her door, when --

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey!  50. Hannah and the girls and our boys all look up to see a BI COP approaching.

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: Boys! The Girls realize the Cop is addressing the Boys. They quickly drive away.

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any reason you guys aren't in school?

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: We go to a Jewish day school and today’s a Jewish holiday.

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, gotcha. The Bike Cop begins to pedal away.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (calling out, politely) Excuse me, Cop? The Bike Cop looks up.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are some sketchy girls ina Mini Cooper that were making anti- semitic remarks and made us feel unsafe.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Can you let the police know so they’1l stop?

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: I am the police.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: No, like the ones with cars and guns.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: And pants. (then, helpful) The real police.

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: (annoyed) I am the real police. I’1l talk to the girls.  51.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Wait, I have a question. What’s next? Do you become a horse cop and then you get a car?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Duh. It goes walking cop, bike cop, horse cop. (then) Do you know anyone in SWAT?

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Or a Navy SEAL?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Are you allowed to wear pants if it’s raining? The Bike Cop shakes his head and bikes off.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What an asshole. He didn’t answer any of our questions.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: He’s probably upset because he doesn’t have a car. I/E. JASLYN’S CAR - DAY Jaslyn drives.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If they narc’d on us, I’1l kill them. Lily’s phone BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s Jordy. Jaslyn pulls up to a red light. Lily reads the text.

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reading) “Call me.” All caps.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Fuck! How are we supposed to explain that a bunch of little kids stole the Molly?  52.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Jordy’s Molly. (then, correcting) Six thousand bucks worth of Jordy’s Molly. We are so fucked. The Bike Cop pulls up next to them, KNOCKS on their windo The Girls jump and SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our boys, sweaty and tired, bike down the sidewalk of the busy thoroughfare. They round a corner -- and then, like oasis in the desert -- they see -- The Fashion Square Mall.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We made it! They cheer. High-fives all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bike Cop approaches Hannah’s car. Hannah rolls down h window. Her eyes are welling up.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (choking back tears) Am I in trouble? The Bike Cop sighs.

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: You don’t need to cry... What are you girls doing out of school? Lily leans over from the passenger seat. She’s crying, to

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (tearing up) We have off-campus lunch privileges. From the back, also crying --

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: We're upperclassmen.

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Seriously. Cut it with the crying.  53. They all stop crying. BIKE COP (CONT’D) Second, stop harassing those kids.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: They were harassing us!

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: I don’t care! Be role models. Those little boys look up to you.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: That's really inspiring.

dialogues.speaker: BIKE COP
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Just go back to school. The Bike Cop walks off. Hannah turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Call Jordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily’s Mini has pulled over, hazards flashing. A hulking F-150 with an illegal tint job pulls up behind them. They tense, nervously awaiting their fate. TRUCK NUTZ dangle from the back bumper. The front door of the pickup opens, revealing a TATTOOED HAND. A combat boot steps out.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Hey, Jordy.

dialogues.speaker: TURN TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: JORDY, 18 -- and she’s not happy. Inked up from her hands her neck. Dressed like Dennis Hopper in Easy Rider, tassl suede jacket, ripped jeans.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (whispers) Why does she dress like that?  54.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (whispers) She went on “23 and Me” and found out she’s one-sixteenth Apache. Jordy stares the girls down. There’s a menace to her.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: I had to leave anger management early to deal with this shit. (then) Hannah, come here. Hannah doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here. I’m not gonna hurt you. (then) Once blood, always blood. Hannah reluctantly walks over to Jordy.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if your cunt dad hadn't divorced my mom, we’d still be sisters.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (nervous ) I still think of you as a sister. A Minivan pulls up to a red light. The passenger window r down. RAFI is playing. A little girl sits in a car seat. SUBURBAN DAD calls through the window:

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN DAD
dialogues.text: If you’re going to park here, you should put on your hazards.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Okay, sorry. / We're moving.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Don’t come at me.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN DAD
dialogues.text: I was just saying, this is a really busy street and the cars fly by. Jordy takes a step toward his car.  55.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: You keep coming for me, but I didn’t send for you. So don’t tell me where I can stand, bitch. The girls exchange a look -- Jordy'’s crazy. Scared, he rolls up his window and stares straight ahead. light turns GREEN and the minivan PEELS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Hey, Jordy, we need to get back to school, so...

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Yeah, that’s not gonna happen. Hannah rides with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your basic suburban mall. Muzak. Fountains. Food court. Fluorescent lighting. Pac Sun. Lids. GNC. Aldo. Starbucks Starbucks-To-Go. The doors automatically open and our boys step in. They made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, Quentin, X-Ray and Fabrizio race up the escalator, pushing past shoppers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s mostly electric corkscrews and towel warmers. Fabrizio plays with an electric corkscrew as the others approach the check-out counter. The Brookstone SALESMAN, with thinning hair and goatee, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hi. I called about the Phantom 3 Standard Quadcopter drone.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: I spoke to a woman.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That was me.  56.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, we sold it.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: What?! No!

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, just sold the last one. Like, ten minutes ago. The boys are shell-shocked. The Salesman laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’M JUST FUCKING WITH YOU, BRO. He pulls it out from underneath the counter. They breathe sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, do you guys want the three year warranty? They hadn't considered this.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Do we need it?

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: It’s piece of mind. It’s protection. It’s a condom.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh okay, thanks. In the b.g., Fabrizio sits in a vibrating massage chair.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Very smart. And do you guys want the guarantee?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What about the warranty?

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: The warranty’s great, but it doesn’t cover everything. The guarantee covers the rest.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (glancing at others) Uh, okay.  57.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Alright, we’re all set. Oh, wait. I forgot the most important one: do you want Brookstone Care?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Do we need it?

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Do you travel internationally?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What? Fabrizio flips over in the chair so that the front of his body is pressed into the chair.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Look, say you’re with your parents in Spain and they start fighting in some tapas restaurant. You’re like, fuck it, I don’t need this. And you go outside to play with your drone. And then you fly the thing into a thousand year old church. Hey, that’s cool, I’ve got a warranty and a guarantee, life is good... (buzzer sound) Ehhhh! Here’s what you don’t know. The warranty and guarantee are only good in the continental United States and some parts of Canada. Brookstone Care is worldwide. So should I throw it in or do you want to be fucked in Europe?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: «+. Okay. Let’s take it, just to be safe. Fabrizio is now straddling the chair, his legs dangling o the arms. He’s really working the chair.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Very smart. How old are you guys? Eight? Nine?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN X-RAY
dialogues.text: Twelve and a half. Almost thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Exactly, so I was in the range. The Salesman rings up the drone.  58.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, the drone is five-fifty and then another three-twenty for the protection plans, et cetera... that’1l be... nine hundred nine dollars and eighty-eight cents.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We only have enough money for the drone.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Why’d you let me go on about the protection plans? I’ve got shit to do. Fuck. The Salesman removes the warranties from the price.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Five eighty-two and eighty-eight cents.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No, just the drone.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: That is just the drone.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The drone is five-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: And tax. Are you familiar with tax?

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we call them push pins.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Sales tax! Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: But this is all we have.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Can’t help you.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (re X-Ray) Look, if we don’t get that drone, his dad is going to kill him. He’s crazy. He drinks wine every night. And he once screamed at me for going into his music memorabilia room without permission.  59.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: This is my business...

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Whoa, you’re Brookstone?

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Just... come back when you have thirty-eight dollars or don’t come back. (then, noticing Fabrizio) Hey, stop fucking the chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys stand dejectedly outside of Brookstone.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Fucking taxes. Now I get why my dad hates paying them. The other guys try to comfort him, but are clearly distra by something just off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (glancing off) We'll figure it out. There has to be, um, a way of, um, the money.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (glancing off) Yeah, um, your dad and, um, the

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (staring) Yes. Suck it, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MOTHER BREASTFEEDING ON A BENCH a few feet away. notices them staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MOTHER
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: We just think your baby is adorable. The Young Mother rolls her eyes.  60.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She would make so much money if she charged for that.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: I wish I had breasts. We’d get the money so fast.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Wait, we have something better than breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half full. RETIREES read newspapers and eat alone. MALL EMPLOYEES on lunch break. Tired MOTHERS contend with rest children.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (counting off) A one, a two, a one two three...

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: As he belts out the first lines of ADELE’s “Rolling in th Deep” in an angelic falsetto.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (singing) There’s a fire / starting in my heart / Reaching a fever pitch / it is bringing me out the dark... Customers slowly look up from their food to find -- Fabrizio standing ON TOP OF A TABLE and singing his heart out. He sings in perfect English.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (singing) Finally I can see you crystal clear / Go ahead and sell me out and I’1l lay your shit bare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Quentin, at the next table over. They begin rhythmically pounding their fists onto the table, providi back beat.  61.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) The scars of your love remind me of us / They keep me thinking that we almost had it all. Fabrizio walks over to a SIX-YEAR OLD sitting with his mo and musses his hair. The boy pushes Fabrizio away, who continues to perform.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) The scars of your love, they leave me breathless / I can’t help feeling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ESCALATOR. X-Ray RIDES down the bannister. At the bot he jump off and dance-jogs into the Food Court. He joins Fabrizio in the chorus.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO/MAX
dialogues.text: (singing) We could have had it allllllll. Max and Quentin jump on their table and sing backup. Quen accidentally steps on an OLD MAN’s burrito.

dialogues.speaker: MAX/QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (singing backup) You're gonna wish you never had met me.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO/X-RAY
dialogues.text: (singing) Rolling in the deee-eeep.

dialogues.speaker: MAX/QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (singing backup) Tears are gonna fall/rolling in the deep.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO/X-RAY
dialogues.text: (singing) You had my heart inside of your hand. Max and Quentin grab two ORANGE TRAFFIC CONES nearby and through them, like two synchronized trumpeters. The Guys are way more into it than the Shoppers, although few mouth the words.  62.

dialogues.speaker: SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (singing along) You're gonna wish -- Quentin immediately shushes her.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY/FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: You're gonna wish you never had met me. Max comes over to Quentin and they sing to each other, beaming, their faces just inches away.

dialogues.speaker: MAX/QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (singing) And you played it to the beat. A female SECURITY GUARD comes over. Instead of stopping, boys immediately surround her, dancing and singing, tryin incorporate her in to the show.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Wrap it up, children.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS
dialogues.text: (singing) We could’ve had it allll1l1ll. X-Ray and Fabrizio grab squeeze bottles off of a table, sending streams of ketchup and mustard into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stone-faced JANITOR watching. The boys all clasp hands and bow deeply. Shoppers APPLAUD

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Thank you! If you enjoyed today’s performance, please donate.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: And there are still seats available for our winter recital tonight at John Adams Middle School. God bless. The boys take their bike helmets and go table to table soliciting money.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Grazie! Grazie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys exit Brookstone, triumphant. X-Ray holds the lar Drone box over his head. They’re in high spirits.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Max, that was so genius. You don’t even understand -- you saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I can’t believe we still remembered the routine from Sing Camp.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: That song is so old. It came out when we were six! WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Max? They look up to see a SUBURBAN MOTHER, early 40s, dressed workout clothes.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN MOTHER
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Shouldn't you guys be in school? They all look caught. This is really bad, then --

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: «+. My grandmother died.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN MOTHER
dialogues.text: Oh my god! I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: She was murdered by a mugger in Ottawa.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN MOTHER
dialogues.text: That’s horrible! (then) So what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: It’s a Jewish Holiday. Max puts his arm on Fabrizio’s shoulder to quiet him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: My mom took us out of school. We were all close to her. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And my grandmother loved malls, so we came here. The Woman nods, taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN MOTHER
dialogues.text: (looking around) Where’s your mom?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: She's on the phone with the Ottawa Police.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: No leads yet.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN MOTHER
dialogues.text: Well, tell her how sorry I am and that I’m thinking of her.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN MOTHER
dialogues.text: (squeezes his shoulder) And if you don’t want to come to Soren’s birthday tonight, I’m sure he’1l understand. (then, to others) Bye, guys. She walks off. Max returns to the others, who are clearly annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: You're invited to Soren’s party? When were you going to tell us?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I wasn’t going for sure.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Sounded like you were going.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What’s that erratic piece of shit doing this year? Did his dad rent puppies again?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: .-. It’s a kissing party.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuuck.  65.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (covering) No, no, it’s cool. You can finally join the kissing club. Took you long enough.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Girls a’love it when you lick the back of their teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys exit the mall.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: It makes them wet.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Gross. Why?

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: I think from sweat. Fabrizio sees something over Max’s shoulder. His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: They a’found us! The guys look over to see Lily’s MINI charging right at t They take off running. X-Ray struggles to keep up while holding onto the drone box.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. LILY'S CAR
dialogues.text: Lily drives.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Gol Lily FLOORS it, then brakes abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speed bump.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOYS
dialogues.text: Running for their lives. Behind them, Lily continues to f it, brake, gingerly go over a speed bump, and repeat. Quentin turns back to X-Ray.  66.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: X-Ray, come on!

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: The box is heavy! I’m running as fast as I can! Quentin runs back and helps X-Ray carry the box.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We need to find an adult! Suddenly, a black PICKUP TRUCK screeches to a stop, almos running them over. It’s JORDY.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Hey, kiddos. Jordy swings open her door, KNOCKING X-Ray and the drone the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Run! They grab X-Ray and take off into the PARKING STRUCTURE.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: The drone! We have to go back for it.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna die!

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: She picks up the drone box from the ground and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordy's truck slowly drives down the aisles looking for t boys... They’re nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: (to herself) Come here, little babies... Come to mama... Hannah scans the garage from the passenger window. Nothin They pass a MINIVAN and continue down the row. A WOMAN approaches the mini-van, gets in, and drives off,

dialogues.speaker: OUR BOYS LYING IN THE NOW-EMPTY PARKING SPOT.
dialogues.text: They stand, covered in dirt, grease, and oil and scurry o to a nearby stairwell, narrowly avoiding -- LILY’S MINI. She pulls up alongside Jordy’s truck. Lily rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: They’re not on the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: We don’t need to find them. They’11 come to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “Pretty Little Liars” theme song PLAYS. Max pulls out Hannah’s phone, checks the caller ID. It reads: CRAZY BIT

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (to others) It says “Crazy Bitch.”

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Answer it. It could be important. Max answers. The others listen.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. JORDY’S TRUCK - SAME Jordy speaks into her truck’s bluetooth.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna make this real simple: give me my Molly back and I'll let you get back to recess. Max covers the phone, turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Who’s Molly? The boys shrug.  68.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (confused) We don’t have your friend.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Molly is drugs. You have Hannah’s bag, which has my drugs.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (eyes go wide) Illegal drugs?

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Yes, you stupid fucking cunt!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (covering phone, to others) I think she’s angry.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Do you know who you’re talking to?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Umm, you came up as “Crazy Bitch” on the phone...? Jordy shoots Hannah a dirty look. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Alright, here's what’s gonna happen: there’s a playground on the corner of Chandler and Van Nuys. Meet me there in thirty minutes. Call the cops and you’ll never see your family again. Quentin holds out his phone to the others.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I just looked it up. Molly is a sex drug. We’re dealing with nymphomaniacs. This rocks them to their core.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We've been carrying illegal drugs the whole time and we didn’t even know. We’re such idiots. Max opens his bag, pushes the paintball gun aside and gra HANNAH'S BAG. He pulls out the FLINTSTONES PILL BOX.  69. Quentin takes the pill container and tries to open it. He struggles with the child seal.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Let me try. Fabrizio bangs the pill box against the metal railing.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuuuuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They all take turns trying to open the container. -- X-Ray throws it against the wall. -- Max tries using the edge of the step as a fulcrum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ELDERLY WOMAN opens the pill bottle for them.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: You'll get nice and strong now.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS
dialogues.text: Thank you! She walks off. Fabrizio’s about to pull one out when Quen stops him.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Never touch drugs. Fabrizio carefully dumps a pill onto his outstretched shi On the pill is a SMILEY FACE EMOJI. They look relieved.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: I thought it would look different.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: What if they spread them into our community?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Well, we don’t know if it’s our community or some other community.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What if it’s a trap?  70.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: You think everything’s a trap! It’s a business transaction. They’re businesswomen. If they fuck us, we'll never do business with them again.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Like I care.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: My dad’s probably on his way home. We have to get the drone.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It’s too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (snatches pill box) I’m making the trade, with or without you.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’m coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: I come, too.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (pointed, to Max) Friends don’t leave friends behind. Max shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m coming. It’s just... drugs on a playground... I hope there’s no kids there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys sit on the swings, waiting. X-Ray checks his wat

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (looking around) This playground is sweet. We should come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally. Check out those monkey bars.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Wasn’t talking to you. 71. Jordy’s truck and Lily’s Mini pull up. The girls exit the and approach. Lily holds the drone box. The boys tense.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Strip.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (nervous ) What, why??

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: How do I know you’re not wearing a wire? The boys are petrified. They look at one another and then slowly unlace their sneakers. Fabrizio casually begins undressing.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (laughs) I’m just fucking with you. (then, serious) Give me my shit. Max pulls Hannah’s bag from his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Same time. X-Ray approaches Lily. Max walks over to Jordy.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One, two --

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: (snatching bag) Just give me the bag. Lily gives X-Ray the drone box. Jordy looks through the bag, pulls out the pill box. a shake.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good boys. Hannah takes the bag, rifles through it. Gives it  72.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: My phone’s not in here. Quentin holds up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: That wasn’t part of the deal.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Look, I just want my phone back. I‘1l delete your pictures. We weren't really going to post them.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: How do we know we can trust you?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Do you pledge it?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: What? (then) I'll delete them right in front of you. Quentin looks at the other boys. They nod. Quentin walks and hands the phone to Hannah. She opens her phone to REV the pictures of the BOYS DRESSED IN DRAG. Jordy looks over and cackles. She snatches the phone from Hannah and starts typing.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: I’m posting these.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Jordy, don't... we were just messing with them.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s what I’m doing... And... posted. Jordy tosses the phone back to Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if you delete them, I’11l crush your skull with my thighs. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) Let's go. Hannah, Jaslyn, and Lily look back at our boys, whose eye start to well up.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (holding tears back) Hannah’s sister will re-post it to her 40,000 followers.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (quiet, holding back tears) Do not cry in front of the girls. The girls mouth “sorry” and follow after Jordy. The boys desperately trying to hold back their tears. As soon as t girls hop in the car, the flood gates open. All four boys BURST INTO TEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys, still crying, pedal down the sidewalk in silenc The drone box sits in the basket of Max's bike.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: My life is over.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: I move back to Italy. Something catches Max’s eye. He drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hide! The boys quickly duck down between two parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: What now? Max points across the street. They all turn to see X-Ray’ Dad exiting a jewelry store with a small bag. He heads to parked car.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (panicked) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I don’t think he saw us.  74.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (relieved) Okay, he’s leaving... A YOUNG WOMAN exits the jewelry store and follows X-Ray’s to his car. She gets in.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Who’s that woman?

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: It’s Dana. She works with my dad. X-Ray’s Dad and the Woman share a passionate KISS in the The boys watch, shell-shocked, as the car drives off. They all fall silent. None of them know what to say. Afte beat --

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (quiet) Maybe they’re just friends.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: «+. I don’t want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What are you going to tell your mom?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: He doesn’t want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: My best friend is going through a crisis, so can you mind your own business? Quentin awkwardly puts his arm around X-Ray.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m here for you. We all are.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: I do sleepover. Max hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’1l come by in the morn --  75.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me right now? Our friend needs us.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I already promised Soren. What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I want you to be there for your friend. You think Soren will be there when shit goes down?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Quentin. I skipped school. I don’t even know where the fuck I am. I could get in so much trouble. I’m risking everything for my friend.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: That’s not because you’re a good friend. That’s just because you feel guilty. Admit you’d rather be with Soren.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I do. He doesn’t freak out every time I do something without him and he can talk about things other than singing. It’s hard being your friend.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I expect a lot because I give a lot. (then) Fabrizio is a better friend than you and we've only known him three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Grazie.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (to Max) You're a... (searching for word) Travesty!

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (stepping between them) Okay, okay...  76.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You're the most insecure person I’ve ever met.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I thought you were woke, but you’re the least woke person ever.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Quentin, you’re not woke!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: My dads are gay! Of course I’m woke!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That’s your excuse for everything!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Eat my ass, honey! You’re the biggest traitor ever. Go jerk off to Mrs. Huberty’s yearbook picture.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That was a secret! Max pushes him. Quentin pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Guys, a’stop. They feint pushing one another.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It’s your fault we’re even here!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Have fun when Soren drops you and then you’ll have no squad! Max lamely does a side kick.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No karate!

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: They look over to see the drone box on the ground. X-Ray picks it up and slams it to the ground. The boys watch in shock. He kicks the box, then picks it up and swings it into a telephone pole. Fabrizio takes a step forward to stop him but Quentin holds him back.  77. X-Ray drops the destroyed box in a trash can.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: I’m going home. X-Ray doesn’t wait for the others and starts to bike off. They start to follow. Quentin turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Find your own way back.

dialogues.speaker: ON X-RAY AND FABRIZIO, WITH QUENTIN ON HIS PEGS --
dialogues.text: Biking down a sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX --
dialogues.text: Biking down a different sidewalk, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all biking down opposite sides of the same street Max sees Quentin and the others turn down a side street a disappear. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streetlights hum to life as the sun sets. Max's phone RINGS. He stops and pulls his phone from his backpack. Checks th caller ID: QUENTIN. Max answers. (cool) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: So, we got stopped by some cops...  78.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Shit! Did you tell them you were Jewish?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: They didn’t care. But we told them everything about the girls and the drugs. They’re being really cool about it and said they’d let us go if you bring the real drugs. Do you still have them? Max pulls a FLINTSTONES VITAMIN PILL BOX from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. Text me the address. Quentin nervously glances over his shoulder to REVEAL -- Jordy menacingly playing with a butterfly knife in an ABANDONED RAILYARD.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hey, and I’m sorry for earlier. I didn’t mean what I said.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: And I’m sorry I told everyone that you jerked off to the lunch lady. Jordy shakes her head. She motions for Quentin to wrap it

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Maybe the cops can give us a ride back to school.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Good idea. I’1ll ask. (then, to Jordy) Can you drive us back for our recital, Officer St. Cloud?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO MAX
dialogues.text: His eyes go wide -- “Officer St. Cloud?”

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAILYARD
dialogues.text: X-Ray and Fabrizio look up -- “Officer St. Cloud?”  Jordy glares at Quentin, doesn’t say anything. Quentin nervously puts the phone back to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Officer St. Cloud said yes.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks for letting me know. I’1ll see you soon. Max hangs up. He thinks, then makes another call. 79.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. SOREN’S BEDROOM - SAME Soren studies three OUTFITS laid out on his bed. His phon rings.

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: (into phone) What’s up, Bitch?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (urgent) Hey, I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Kinda in the middle of something.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Some older girls kidnapped Quentin, X-Ray and Fabrizio.

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I didn’t know who else to call. The girls are in your brother's grade. Maybe he could call them or something.

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: I’m sure Quentin and those guys are just being weak.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It’s real! They’re in trouble!

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m busy!  80.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: «+. Okay, forget it. Max hangs up, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saticoy and Van Nuys. This is a far cry from the bright lights of Ventura Boulevard. A graffitied billboard for a long-shuttered strip club hangs above a blown out ticketi office. Jordy’'s headlights illuminate Quentin, X-Ray, and Fabriz all huddled together on the ground. Jordy grabs one of the boys’ bikes from the bed of her tr and tosses it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, LILY, AND JASLYN
dialogues.text: They speak in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: We're literally involved in a kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Don’t be so dramatic. We didn’t kidnap them. We just took them.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: We're kidnapped, too.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: No, we’re not.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Tell Jordy that we need to go. What’s her problem?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: She’s always been crazy. When she was fourteen, she dated a thirty year old.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Isn't that illegal?

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Yeah. She should be in jail.  81.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Hannah, you need to tell her we need to go. Hannah shakes her head, scared. Jordy grabs the other bikes from the back of her truck.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: You think you can switch out my drugs for kids vitamins and there won't be consequences? She tosses the bike on top of the other and walks back to truck. She rummages inside, grabs something from the glov compartment. Quentin looks around for an escape.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (whispers) Okay, I’m going to cause a diversion by pretending I have appendicitis. Behind them, Jordy walks over to the bikes and DOUSES the with lighter fluid.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (oblivious) When they come over to see what’s wrong, you guys grab the bikes and haul ass. (then) Ready? On three -- WHOOSH! The boys’ bike IGNITE into a pyre of twisted meta and rubber. The boys watch in horror as their only way ho goes up in flames.

dialogues.speaker: JASLYN
dialogues.text: Hey, Jordy, I need to get going. I have dinner with my grand --

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: No one goes anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pedals furiously down the sidewalk. He skid stops and races over to a TRASHCAN. He rummages through it until he pulls out --  82. THE DRONE. He tears open the box and inspects the damaged contents. lifts a propeller that’s broken in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordy sits on her truck bumper. The TRUCK NUTZ dangle bet her legs. She cracks her neck, checks her watch. The remains of the bikes smolder in the background.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I need to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Hold it in.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I could get a UTI!

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Hannah, take the dwarf. Quentin bristles as Hannah leads him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quentin has his back to Hannah. He looks over his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I can’t pee while you’re here.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Believe me, I’m not trying to look. He starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: She didn’t have to say that.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: That I’m a dwarf. I’m not a dwarf.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Okay.  83.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I don't suffer from dwarfism. That’s offensive to me and it’s offensive to dwarfs. (then) Why are you friends with her?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: When you’re in high school, sometimes you're not friends with your friends.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: My best friend is ditching us for the popular kids because he thinks we're losers.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Because we’re not into sports, we’re into singing.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Are you good?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: We won the tri-county Voice of an Angel tournament last year.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: That’s cool. I wish I could sing.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m so jealous of people who can sing. This buoys Quentin’s spirits. They start to head back, Quentin walking a little bit taller.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Hey, you should come to our recital later.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I hate to break it to you, but I don’t think we’re getting out of here any time soon.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR a sputtering hum. ON an OLDER COUPLE -- SOMETHING comes right at them. They duck out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: ON A CAR --
dialogues.text: The bored DRIVER’s eyes suddenly go wide and she REAR-END the car in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: TURN TO REVEAL THE DRONE --
dialogues.text: Sputtering down the middle of the street, like a drunken bumble bee. The drone drops five feet, swerves to the lef then coughs its way back to its flight path. It turns down a street, rising higher and higher.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX --
dialogues.text: Manning the drone from his iPhone while simultaneously biking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking in the location from above:

dialogues.speaker: -- THE BOYS HUDDLED BY THEIR BURNING BIKES
dialogues.text: (Note: it has a striking resemblance to the GRAND THEFT A level the boys played earlier.)

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX
dialogues.text: Surveilling the layout on the drone controller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRONE, sputtering, flying erratically. It suddenly dr twenty-five feet. Stabilizes, then drops again.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do you hear that noise? Jordy and the girls look up to see the drone quickly descending like a comet, flying past them and crashing in JORDY’S WINDSHIELD.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! She pulls the drone from the cracked windshield. She sees note attached to it. She opens it.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reading) “Moist.” The Girls grumble.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Ugh! / I hate that word. / What kind of pervert would write that?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (to X-Ray and Fabrizio) It’s Max!

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Leave now and you won’t get hurt! Jordy flicks open her butterfly knife, waves it toward th boys.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: I’m about to start cuttin’ off fingers.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (shrieking)

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX
dialogues.text: Perched on the roof, the paintball gun pressed into his shoulder, like a sniper. His finger touches the trigger. adjusts the sight -- Jordy is in the CROSS-HAIRS. And he FIRES -- And hits Fabrizio in the kneecap!  86.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!! I bleeding! (then, checking) No, it’s paint.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Dammit! Max starts SHOOTING, spraying paint everywhere. They all cover, hiding behind Jordy’s car. Jordy grabs Quentin and puts the knife to his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Stop shooting or I cut his pinky!

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Jordy! Stop! / What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: (calling to Max) What’s it gonna be, tough guy? In the shadows, Max cautiously steps down a wooden ladder attached to the building, making certain to put both feet each rung. He jumps the last one, dropping eighteen inche the ground. He lifts his arms up in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (nervously) Don’t hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: I am gonna hurt you, but first you're gonna give me the drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paintball gun is messily taped to the back of Max’s T shirt. Max pulls the Flintstone Pill Box from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (re pills) I won’t let you destroy my community -- or any community -- with these.  87.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: I’m going to enjoy this. She shoves Quentin out of the way and charges Max with th outstretched knife. Max reaches behind down his back for his paintball gun, b he’s taped it TOO LOW. He reaches up his back, but it’s TOO HIGH.

dialogues.speaker: ON JORDY
dialogues.text: Now running full speed, snarling and determined, just lik the pitbull chasing Josh Brolin through the river in “No Country For Old Men.” As she leaps, Max pulls his shirt over his head, giving h access to the gun. And at the last moment -- HE SHOOTS HER POINT BLANK IN THE FACE. Jordy goes down, writhing on the ground, her face covered BLUE PAINT splatter.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Abhh!! Fuck! Ahhh! Fuck!! Max DROPS the gun in shock -- that wasn’t a video game.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Holy sheet! You shot her in the fucking face.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Quentin runs to Jordy’s truck, hops in, and pulls the key from her visor.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Got her keys!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: She burned our bikes. It’s the only way to make it back in time. (then, to X-Ray) But only if you still want to sing.  88.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Fuck, yeah I wanna sing. This might be the last time we ever sing together. SPLAT! A paintball EXPLODES on the windshield beside X-Ra face.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: Jordy leveling the paintball gun on the boys. She has a crazed look in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: I‘1l fucking end you!

dialogues.speaker: SPLAT
dialogues.text: The guys jump into the truck, narrowly avoiding the paint Quentin turns the ignition and keeps turning it, shreddin the starter. The truck REVERSES at high speed, kicking up a cloud of d before missing the exit and SMASHING THROUGH THE CHAIN LI FENCE, FISHTAILING out onto the street. INT. JORDY’S TRUCK - CONTINUOUS Heavy breathing.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Seat belts. We hear the CLICKS of belts being buckled. Quentin puts the truck in DRIVE and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: THE YARD
dialogues.text: Disgusted, Jordy points the paintball gun at Hannah's fac who instinctively puts her hands up.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Take me to the recital, fam.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SHERMAN WAY
dialogues.text: A HELL’S ANGEL rumbles down the street. He looks over to right to see Jordy’s truck -- he double takes as it looks like the truck is driving itself.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. JORDY'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: The seat has been moved all the way forward and all the w up, yet Quentin can still barely see over the steering wh Max, X-Ray, and Fabrizio are crowded beside him. Max look his phone’s GPS.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Take this ramp! Quentin jerks across two lanes of traffic to make the 170 freeway entrance. He steadies the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're doing good.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Thanks. (then, quiet) You came back for us.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (solemn) I pledged it. Quentin reaches over and Max takes his hand -- they do th “pledge” clasp. Up ahead, the rush hour traffic is slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Shit. There’s too much traffic. We’re not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (pointing to the shoulder) There’s no one in that lane.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Good eye, Maxwell! Quentin swerves onto the shoulder and guns it. The Truck FLIES past the stopped traffic.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Why doesn’t anyone use this lane?!  90.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Probably because people are sheep.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck. Five-oh.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: Now we’ll miss the recital.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We’re gonna get grounded.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: We're not getting grounded and we're not gonna miss that recital. Quentin SWERVES ACROSS FIVE LANES OF TRAFFIC TO GET ON TO 101 FREEWAY. The boys cheer. The cheers fade when the see the gridlock ahead.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: LA has a real traffic problem. A SIREN screams as flashing lights pull up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. POLICE CRUISER
dialogues.text: The STATE TROOPER barks into the police radio.

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: Code 3. 2-Adam-4 in pursuit of a black Ford F-150 heading southbound on the 405. Possible drunk driver. JORDY’S TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What’s happening? Max tilts the REARVIEW MIRROR completely toward the passe side.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Cop's still there. Lose him! We could get grounded!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: This guy’s so erratic!  91. Quentin cuts the wheel, hops off the freeway and onto an EMBANKMENT. The engine WHIRS as the truck OFFROADS up the hill. The Cop Car attempts to follow them, but BOTTOMS OU when it hits the embankment, shooting SPARKS everywhere. The black and white slides to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Hannah drives. Lily and Jaslyn sit in the back. Jordy stares straight ahead, her finger dancing on the trigger of Max’s PAINTBALL GUN. In the dark of night, wit the dried blue paint cracked across her skin, she looks possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen cars snake into the driveway, passing a school Marquee that reads:

dialogues.speaker: TONIGHT 645 PM
dialogues.text: “WINTER CONCERT: MANIFEST DESTINY”

dialogues.speaker: I/E. JORDY'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: The boys pull up a block away from the school.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: We can walk from here.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Wait. I can’t bring drugs into the school. It’s a drug-free zone.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: If you leave it in the car, some little kids might think they’re vitamins and O.D. Max pulls out a pen and writes a note. He tapes it to the pill box.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We'll come back later and give it to an adult. Quentin shuts off the truck (leaving it in “Drive”). They quickly exit and start running toward the school.  92.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM --
dialogues.text: JORDY’S TRUCK BEGINS TO SLOWLY ROLL DOWN THE STREET. It picks up speed, side-swiping a row of parked cars and leaving a trail of broken side mirrors in its wake. It ho the curb, rolls through a grassy median. Cars honk and swerve.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: A SPOTLIGHT shines from the Police Cruiser as a COP looks any sign of the truck. He talks into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (into radio) I’m on Hazeltine. Pretty quiet over here. Wait, I’m hearing something -- A sound -- metal scraping? -- comes closer... and... clos Car alarms begin going off. The Cop shines his spotlight then stops on -- THE LION.

dialogues.speaker: COP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Holy shit! The Cop looks back just in time -- To see Jordy’s truck barreling down the street BACKWARDS his cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: The Truck T-BONES the POLICE CAR. The Lion runs off into woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys race up the stairs and burst into the school --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the harsh fluorescent light, we see the toll the day h taken on them: ripped and dirty clothes. Grimy faces. The look like they’ve been through battle.  93. The boys race down an empty hallway, turn a corner and re civilization: STUDENT VOLUNTEERS serve refreshments to PARENTS, TEACHERS, and SIBLINGS. The boys freeze as peopl look up and stare. The boys race past them toward the side entrance to the auditorium when they hear a stern voice.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Xavier Raymond. They all turn to see X-Ray’s Dad. Quentin turns to X-Ray.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’m going to tell him it was my fault.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We'll tell him it was all of us.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: No. X-Ray nervously walks over to his dad. The others watch. X-RAY’S DAD What happened to your clothes? You're filthy. What’s going on with you? X-Ray stares at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: (quiet) I broke your drone. X-RAY’S DAD Speak up. Take responsibility for your actions. (then) This is why you’re going to Camden next year. You need to learn character.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go. X-RAY’S DAD Well, it’s not your decision. After the show, we’re going to sit down and have a talk about respect and honesty. X-Ray looks his father directly in the eye.  94.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Is Dana going to be there? Beat. X-RAY’S DAD Xavier-Raymond, it’s not --

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Like I said, I don’t want to go. X-Ray heads back to the others, surprised at his newfound courage.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: I/E. JORDY’S TRUCK - NIGHT Two other Black and Whites are on the scene, surveying th damage of Jordy’s totaled Truck and the police cruiser. A COP inspects the inside of the truck. Lowers the visor. Pops open the glove compartment, pulls out the registrati He’s about to step out when something on the floor catche his eye. He reaches over and picks it up. It’s a FLINTSTONES PILL BOX with a note taped to the side “ILLEGAL SEX DRUGS -- DO NOT EAT” Off his look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys frantically change into costume. Soren walks ove

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: Hey bitches, saw your pics on Instagram. Did it take you a long time to do your makeup?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (stymied) -.. We didn’t do it ourselves. The boys deflate.  95.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: For the record, I’m not coming to your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: (scoffs) You think you’re still invited? You and your squad is tragic.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (correcting) We are tragic. Soren shakes his head and walks off. Robin, dressed in al BLACK, runs up to them.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: You’re not in costume?! You’re on in thirty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’m on your mom in thirty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: She's still in San Diego! I just talked to her on the phone! He races off. The boys hurriedly change into their costum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtain is down. Mrs. Grandy, wearing an Old West-sty dress, walks onto the stage to polite applause. She sits at the piano and begins PLAYING the jaunty opening to “GH RIDERS IN THE SKY.” Robin pulls up the curtain to REVEAL --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Dozens of iPhones go up, poised to record.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAGE
dialogues.text: A few boys “ride” in on papier-maché horse heads connecte broom sticks. Our boys proudly step to the front row. Their LASSOS are latched onto their pleather belts.  96. As they sing, they use hand motions and choreography to a out the lyrics and give the audience a better sense of th song’s story.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS CHORUS
dialogues.text: (singing) An old cowboy went riding out one dark and windy daaaaaay / Upon a ridge he rested as he went along his waaaaaaay... The SONG plays over the following --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights of the school can be seen a block away. Jordy and the girls approach the accident scene. Police lights, fire trucks and ambulances are everywhere. The Girls are alarmed by the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh my god. They’re dead. Jordy sees her crumpled up truck. She slams the dashboard tucks the paintball gun into her waistband.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: They’re dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our boys step to the front, now holding their LASSOS. The twirl them over their heads, while continuing to sing.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS CHORUS
dialogues.text: (singing) A bolt of fear went through him as they thundered through the skyyyyy--- The boys now lower their lassos and deftly jump in and ou the rope. The audience APPLAUDS. BOYS CHORUS (CONT’D) For he saw the riders coming hard and he heard their mournful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering from the back. With her suede fringe jacket and paint, she looks like she’s part of the show. In the audience, a FATHER nudges his daughter and points Jordy.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Oh, look, it’s a Native American. Jordy heads toward the stage, followed closely by the oth girls.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (whispering) Are you nuts? There are parents here.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE BOYS
dialogues.text: They spot Jordy. Uh oh. They share a look -- there’s nowh to run.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS CHORUS
dialogues.text: Yippie yi oohhhh... All the boys but Max drop their ropes and begin to form a human pyramid, still singing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Hannah, Lily, and Jaslyn step in front of Jordy.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: (growling) MOVE. She lifts her shirt and pulls out the PAINTBALL GUN. Lily Jaslyn, frightened, run back toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS CHORUS
dialogues.text: Their faces gaunt, their eyes were blurred / Their shirts all soaked with sweat...

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Soren and some other bigger kid form the base, followed b Ray, Fabrizio, and Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: ON JORDY AND HANNAH
dialogues.text: Hannah holds her ground. Jordy shoves Hannah out of the w  98. BOYS CHORUS (CONT’D) He's riding hard to catch that herd But he ain't caught em yet... Max climbs to the top and continues to twirl his rope. Th audience goes nuts.

dialogues.speaker: ON JORDY
dialogues.text: Leveling the paintball gun at Max. As she’s about to shoot, Hannah SHOVES her from behind. J squeezes the trigger as she trips, which causes her to mi fire and shoot Soren IN THE FACE. Over the singing, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: SOREN
dialogues.text: Owww ! He collapses... Which causes the whole pyramid to collapse. The deaf Mrs. Grandy, eyes closed, oblivious, keeps playing. The audience turns, sees Jordy wielding the paintball gun

dialogues.speaker: JORDY
dialogues.text: Stay in your seats. It’s just a paintball gu -- A rope LASSOS her.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL MAX
dialogues.text: Lassoing Jordy with his lariat. Jordy struggles. She’s ab to break free when --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER LARIAT
dialogues.text: This one belonging to Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE LARIATS
dialogues.text: From Fabrizio and X-Ray. Hannah jumps on top of Jordy to restrain her.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BACK DOORS
dialogues.text: Lily and Jaslyn rush in, followed by several COPS. Mrs. Grandy opens her eyes, sees the chaos, and abruptly stops  99. The Cops head over to Jordy and handcuff her. They pull h from the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: JORDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (not so tough) Call my dad!

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Quentin motions to Max, X-Ray, and Fabrizio.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (whispers) Come on, we need to finish. These people paid for a show. Our boys step forward. They’re the only ones left on stag

dialogues.speaker: BOYS
dialogues.text: (singing) Yippie yi yay... Ghost riders in the skyyyyy- The audience is quiet. Then we hear a few whoops. It’s Hannah, Lily, and Jaslyn. They give the boys a knowing no

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Woo!! The audience, unsure, joins in. Quentin beams, takes the hands of the other boys and they all take a deep bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys walk through the cafeteria carrying their trays. Other kids pat them on the back. Girls smile at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CNN CAMERA CREW and REPORTER trailing them.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (to camera) This is the cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This is where we eat lunch.

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY
dialogues.text: Some kids call it the lunch room, but we call it the cafeteria.  100.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIO
dialogues.text: (points to apple) I eat nine apple a’day. They take a seat at their table. The Reporter sits down w them.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You guys are pretty popular these days.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Thank you. As well, we're big fans. It’s an honor to be on CNN Heroes.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Between the videos of you fighting for women’s reproductive rights at a pro-life rally to capturing a drug dealer to the viral Instagram photos of you dressed as women, which has inspired so many boys and girls to identify with what’s in their heart... you truly are CNN heroes.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (touched) Thank you. Thank you for objectifying us.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, we’re proud of the message, but we’re not really transgender.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What Max means is, we’re still figuring it out. For instance, I love to sing, but I also love to dance. That’s what my bio says on my Instagram account.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Well, for all you’ve done for your community, we have a little surprise for you. The Reporter motions to the entrance. The lights go down.  101. REPORTER (CONT’D) We've brought your favorite singer! Ladies and gentlemen, Lady Gaga! LADY GAGA, dressed in an outfit that is definitely inappropriate for children, bursts through the door.

dialogues.speaker: LADY GAGA
dialogues.text: You guys aren’t just CNN Heroes. You’re my heroes. Any chance I could get you to sing with me? The cafeteria goes crazy. But no one goes crazier than ou boys. Max turns to Quentin, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t think I’m trans.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Let’s put a pin in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soren with a bandage over his bruised nose, watching jealously. Fabrizio takes Lady Gaga’s hand, kisses it, then helps he onto the lunch table. And as they all start singing “BORN THIS WAY,” we FADE TO BLACK.
